Watching this trailer now makes me cry. I remember watching this and then fantasizing how me and my friends will play like we did back in BF4. Battlefield was back. 

Now I watch this and realize that it was all a lie. If only the game was this trailer. It could have been so amazing. For the first time, I truly feel sad for myself regarding Battlefield. Thanks EA and DICE.

author: Sebastian Bosek

comment:
0:20

Anyone who has actually played on the Breakaway map now realizes that Sundance and those soldiers were essentially basejumping out of the map boundaries. Like there's literally nothing over there. And the point they're jumping off of sits at the very top corner of the map on a mountain with no reliable way to get to it except via helicopter or a singular zipline where you can be easily shot at like a fish in a barrel. 

It's the most useless part of the map but they used it as a set piece in the trailer because they knew it would remind all the BF3 fanboys of Damavand Peak and get them hyped. This whole trailer was a giant sham.

comment: Rewatching this trailer now. After all the hate, this trailer didn't lie. Everything in here you can do. The cinematic effects are blown up, explosions are overdrawn, graphics are obviously movie quality, but in terms of what they show here everything is accessible and relevant to the actual game. I guess fans were misled in the fact that there really is no destruction going on here, they didn't anticipate how bad the specialist would play into the usual class system that were used to, and just the lack of overall features in general delivered a pretty disappointing experience.

comment: The hit damage on the official game modes are so unreasonably low that it's almost insulting. The enemies are literally taking barrage missle strike contacts and entire clips, for a single takedown and you can forget about headshots. Get a hard earned headshot and they'll just look at you and move out to cover for someone else to get an easy takedown credit. Why on earth would you make the weapons that weak? Where are the official hardcore modes for seasoned players?  Aim for realism but give no realism? Nothing is satisfying....I did not have fun

author: ThisIsMacDecon

comment:
How to make the worst battlefield game ever

- Throw out the unique, beloved, and time proven battlefield formula.
- implement a hero shooter formula instead
- go all in on skins and microtransactions at the expense of overall content.
- make sure the game is not competitive by removing the scoreboard and nerfing the point system.
- make sure people can't play on their favorite maps or select map size etc (no server browser).
- make sure people can't communicate with each other (no voip or all-chat)
-kill the immersion by making everyone look exactly the same, like clones, and add cringey voicelines on top just to make sure the immersion is really dead.
- make the maps too big and empty, with no destruction.
-make sure there are very few weapons and little customization options.
-dumb down wehicle mechanics so that there's no skill needed to operate them, and therefore also no reward associsted with mastering them.
- add tons of bugs

comment:
"Hello, how are you feeling Mr. 2042?"
"I presented a trailer of myself that was a complete lie"
"Mhm, Mr. 2042 it seems that you're suffering from a severe case of Cyberpunk syndrome, i know this must be hard news for you but i think you will find it comforting to hear that this facility can treat your disease and help you feel better over time"
"My god... does it have a cure?"
"Again, i am very sorry to have to tell you this, but this disease cannot be cured, the treatment can make the symptoms go away for a short period of time, but they are expected to come back as soon as you have kids"
"Oh my lord, what am i gonna do?"

comment: I really enjoyed the game while I played and the entire time playing it, it really did feel like Battlefield. I'd have to say it felt like 4 the most, given the sheer amount of time I put into 4. The glitches and lag weren't nearly as much of an issue as I had heard, and I was playing at launch. The only reason I stopped playing was because I had no one to play with and battlefield just ain't the same without friends. I'd say besides my shots sometimes not registering, the only real problem I have with the game was it's lack of content on drop. Unfinished products, as they have been called, have been my favorite games to play for a while. Just look at Borderlands 3, easily one of my favorites of all time. I'm more or less the same about Back 4 Blood. What I'm trying to get at is if a game feels clunky or even unfinished at launch, if it's fun, who cares.

comment:
I honestly think this reveal trailer is much worse than BFV's. 

While it's technically better than the BFV trailer, it's EXTREMELY deceptive to the point that it's kind of immoral to fans of the series. It promises and heavily emphasizes that BF is going back to the old days, yet the actual game is the furthest DICE could've possibly gone from that. 

They literally manipulated our emotions against us, and that's why it's infinitely worse than the BFV trailer.

author: LIBYA Live ‚Üª

comment:
Corporate greed, lost its identity in a chase to make money from other successful games (Battleroyales), couldn't have coined off its own unique experience supposedly, but turns out it sucks as a BR so they rush to make it a battlefield game again 15 months before the games official release and we get a half baked pile of garbage. The specialists are so cringe it hurts, the original class outfits (pre-warzone release) we're so good. Do Not Support This Game. We paid ¬£100 to beta test before release. The original trailer had everyone suited up hiding their afros and leather belts. U.S and Russia troop encounters have turned into that spiderman meme where they are both pointing at each other. No scoreboard, no game chat. ¬£100 hustled from each of our pockets. I've tried to contact EA and Dice but they don't even answer on their support forums. They've massacred my boy! And to make things worse they are committed to hero characters, I don't want gimmicky characters, that's cringey. I just want a normal geared up soldier, no face, totally ambiguous. They can be a they/them, A-sexual, I don't care that's fine. But I don't wanna see their face, I don't wanna hear them saying how fun everything is. I want them to acknowledge orders, give orders, request support, clear discipline and focus to the importance of the battle, and distinguishable faction outfits. 

(this is the tip of the iceburg, there is so much wrong with this game, and as a games designer myself I see so much that could be changed without much of an overhaul. But this is also a comment on YouTube, I might aswell be farting in the wind I'd probably get a response faster from Dice/EA).

Final thought: If we ever want a Battlefield that we all know and love, this game and that new battleroyale battlefield are making has to fail. It has to fail! We as fans have to restrain ourselves from playing this game. It needs to die and so does the upcoming battleroyale. if it doesnt, Dice/EA will credit all the success to the hero system and that's what we will have forever. Don't buy this game, stop playing it, do not play the future releasing battlefield royale. They manipulated us with this idea that battlefield can be what you make it i.e jet rocket launcher kill, or C4 quad off a building. But that was their way of trying to slip their gimmicky apex hero's into our game. So they could say "its just a game at the end of the day, battlefield has never been serious and anyone who thinks that is a white sexist male". It's all a ruse to steal other games player bases who incorporate gimmicks into their Service (FORTNITE AND WARZONE) while being able dismiss anyone who has anything bad to say about the cringeist hero's ever conceived in a AAA service game. 

Please spread the word and save battlefield. Those few people who do read this, we have to kill this game and the new battlefield with our wallets.

comment: If only you put as much effort into the game as you did this amazing trailer. DICE management effed this game up with their horrendous decisions and it shows in the final product. What they were doing during the 3 years of development and with 6 studios is a big mystery. Bugs at launch would've been normal and fixed in an update or 2 but the abysmal PC performance and loads of missing core mechanics/features is unacceptable at all. I refunded and I hope you make serious improvements in 6 months when I check back not just bugs and performance but adding back core mechanics and features you left out for whatever reason. This trailer is a perfect example of why you shouldnt get too hyped and pre-order. Job well done DICE I guess.

comment: Absolute catastrophe this game. These mouse settings are so bad that you have to invest hours before you find a result that is roughly playable. After more than hours of adjusting, I still can't control the mouse the way I'm used to in Battlefield 4. It takes hours to get a decent weapon. I bought the Ultimate Edition. Watch out, you have absolutely zero advantages, so I strongly advise you not to buy it. You pay over twice as much and have no extras. I have also contacted customer service, but they can't come close to helping. Some people who are not trained at all, it has absolutely nothing to do with technical support, you can save your time. I am massively disappointed, not playable.

comment: One thing I noticed in the reveal trailer is that they feature generic soldiers. Even the Gameplay trailer doesn‚Äôt have 13 Falck or Rao running around . My theory is that they were still implementing the classes during development (with customization similar to BFV, and probably throws in some Elites like they did in that installment), but DICE‚Äôs greedy overlord EA saw the immense profit that Activision generated by its operator system in Warzone and such and decided at some point to make them implement this bogus system. What a shame. The only thing they did keep their word was that the Portal mode would turn out great, but that‚Äôs only a selling point for the game. Apart from the horrid UI, the terrible bloom, game-breaking bugs and abysmal maps, it seems that Dice has truly lost their magic, and continued to go down the path that would lead to their own undoing.

comment:
Battlefield 2042 following the same step as CyberPunk 2077, too much hype but the game ended up being trash, even BF 2042 barely scores 3.0 in metacritic which is very laughable. I never understand with people who overhype this trash, even as BF fans i already know this game will become truly garbage after seeing the direction of this game. The way Dice makes trailer "only in battlefield moments" is just deceiving, they try anything to makes the game overhype but actually they didn't show what the game actually is. 

Sadly many people are so dumb to fall into this trap, i keep reminding them that BF 2042 will become Cyberpunk 2077 they never listen to me and instead backslash me, now see what happens, where are those many people who attacking my opinion now? they all gone, they feel ashamed after attacking my opinion about this CashgrabField 2042.

comment:
This is so sad. Top 10 worst things about this game rn

1. Specialists not being locked into classes and looking the same for both teams.
2. Weapon bloom and balance issues (which lowers the skill ceiling, and makes it more random which is lame)
3. No scoreboard & stats page, all chat, no voice chat
4. Who ever designed this UI should be fired
5. The map design is horrible
6. Cringy voice-lines at the end of round screen
7. Squads are locked to only 4 people
8. Only 2 gamemodes, 22 weapons, and 7 maps is a joke
9. No server browser and after a match everyone gets kicked out of the server
10. Hazard zone should be dead already

Well, you've missed... We played to the game... You lied a lot with this trailer who look like the battlefield we wanted, and in give us a game who didn't seem to be a battlefield. 

With a little hope, maybe you can patch the errors you've done.
-Delete agents, and replace with classes.
-Maps with "levolution" better than now, and mostly more full, and more destructible.
-More weapons.
-Optimisation.
And a lot of other things...

This your choice to do it or not dice, but if you don't do it. I think this battlefield going to be the last. 

Market mens are your demons, fight them, triumph and come back in the blindly light where you come the first time, and retrieve you'r past glory.

comment: We were thinking they are showing us the game is gonna be fun experience with classic Battlefield moments, they were hiding a fact its not near a classic BF experience we had in BF3/4. We were thinking they are showing us gritty soldiers of the future, but these were AI soldiers and sometimes specialists with their goofy faces covered by the only cosmetics items not being a reskins of default one. We were thinking the game is gonna be loaded with action in destruction, in reality its barren wasteland with little to no destruction on certain maps.  We were thinking will 'be fighting on skyscraper's roofs in Korea and Doha, in reality Kaleidoscope has only 4 skyscrapers on the edges of the map noone cares about and Hourglass is mostly a dunes and skyscrapers almost never becomes a point of interest in Breakthrough because the attackers cant win the second stage and reach the city with 3 points with almost no cover required to be capped

author: Rhonmar Dimaano

comment: This game is like a Chinatown knock off of Battlefield or Dollar store version of GI Joe. Why take great ideas that worked, an amalgamation of features and game mechanics that evolved for 20 years and leave them out? Where is the scoreboard,  classes (actual squad roles), server browser,  any stat page, 100+ fps, squad selection, team switching, UI info (like an option to see damage done with each shot), VOICE CHAT!?!?!  Don't give us the tired old excuse that "it maybe coming in a future update" or "we may add it later", you took our money (i refunded and got mine back), we expect a finished game.  These aren't bugs that slipped by testers, these are features intentionally left out.Ill buy it again when its $10 on steam and has the features that should have been in the game upon release.Just stick with one of the dozen other Battlefield or similar games that are out , there's no rush to buy a inferior version of something that already exists.
author: Pat Murphy

comment:
I really enjoy the battlefield series but I wanted to share something because you guys are most likely open to hearing about how to make it the best experience overall. 

This is from a snipers perspective. 

There‚Äôs something very wrong about hit registration and aim assist. And sniping. 

When having any gun other than a sniper rifle when you‚Äôre shooting at someone and aiming down sights the Aim assist throws you off target. And whenever you try to aim on target and the player moves the opposite direction, when you aim to follow them the Aim assist over pushes your aim off the target. 

When sniping, the aim assist and hit reg is so bad, you just shoot through people. It‚Äôs like the Hitbox around the character is so precisely to the players skin that if you even are 1 millimeter off target, you miss. Like it‚Äôs way too much to the point where pretty much 50% of my shots aren‚Äôt registering. and i myself am a very good sniper but there‚Äôs something wrong with the aiming. Sure, it could be i just have to get used to the game but if you throw me on bf3 bf4 or bf5 I have no issues. 

I haven‚Äôt played enough to know all of the next things I‚Äôm about to say about the scopes, I‚Äôm still on the 6x. but the sniper scopes‚Ä¶ they need scopes with measurements and not just the cross-air line. As a sniper in my opinion this makes me not even want to play it. Coming from bf3 and bf4, It seems like the sniping downgraded. 
There‚Äôs also something weird about the bullet drop. for you snipers that have sniped in bf3 and 4 you‚Äôll know what I‚Äôm talking about. In battlefield 2042 500m would be equivalent to about 1000m in battlefield 4. In bf2042 maybe they upgraded in realism‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt know but in the sniper scope in Battlefield 4 you would have to aim up at least two measurements in order to calculate a bullet drop of over 500 m. In battlefield 2042 all you have to do is aim like one little small inch to shoot across the map. The sniping feels like a war zone. 
Because it does the same thing.

Battlefield sniping used to be so legendary before battlefield hardline. To me sniping in battlefield is about calculation and all different ranges - Short, medium, and long. 
I have faith in the entire games growth but something I would really like to see is more in-depth sniper scopes and maybe a fix on the bullet drop. Or maybe instead of fixing the whole bullet drop which they probably won‚Äôt do, they could instead make one of those select meter adjustments like they did in battlefield 4. 

I know I‚Äôm going off of bf4 a lot but Battlefield 4 sniping is in my opinion 100% flawless.

author: kirito _4kirigaya

comment: While I hate the specialist over class system (because let‚Äôs be honest, they‚Äôre only doing this to monetize specialists), I really like this concept. Don‚Äôt want to worry about historical accuracy or realism? Ok, just set your game in a time period where historically accuracy and realism are not expected to be: the future! When you play a game in WW1, WW2, Vietnam, or the Present day, you automatically have expectations for what should and shouldn‚Äôt be in the game for the sake of realism, which is not a bad thing, mind you. But in a time period that hasn‚Äôt happened yet (like 2042), it‚Äôs alright because no one expects it and it gives you more freedom. Brilliant!

comment:
It sucks. Does not feel like battlefield at all.
BF1 had such a great atmosphere, this one does not. Too much gamma, maps are too big, poor mechanics, grapling hooks and specialists is where the circus and mambo-jambo ruins the BF. If it is a beta, and we should wait, then i wait they rebuild the whole game from scratch.
Where's destruction? Where's immersion? The debris, chaos, explosion one could felt in prrvious BF? TTK is horrible, guns have no punch at all. No customization as it were in BF4? Huge mistake then.
Sound design still bad. 
I understand people dont want their new BF6 to be bad, but it is. 
Yeah patches will work for graphics, some things like ttk or bullet velocity and then they will leave us out, because of the promise of  " being developing BF7"
Honestly, this is the end of BF games for me.

comment: Battlefield 2042 had the most serious addiction attack. Lying in bed, I read the Great Sadness Mantra desperately, and I kept scratching my eyes, thinking that it was all right to brush the Post Bar. As a result, I saw that the Post Bar was in Battlefield 2042, and my eyes were going to explode more and more. I fanned my eyes desperately, and the harder I fanned, the more tears came out. I really didn't know what to do. I really wanted to go crazy in 2042. I think about 2042 when I lie in bed, 2042 when I take a shower, 2042 when I go out, 2042 when I walk, 2042 when I take a bus, 2042 when I work, and 2042 when I play with my mobile phone. I really feel like I am possessed by evil. My obsession with 2042 seems to be morbid. I am so lonely! It's really lonely! Do you know that? Every night, my eyes are hot, and I get sick. I want to think crazy about 2042, my eyes can't stand it, 2042, my battlefield 2042.

comment: There is actually a problem with the jet scene. When a pilot ejects from the seat, the seat will come with him as that is what contains the jets which are required to push the seat outwards meaning by if some stroke of luck he really could catch onto the plane he would not have a seat and would make piloting it nearly impossible. I understand dice is trying to put fun over realism but it was just a small detail that I noticed.

comment:
In my opinion, there should be a warfare game on the current world situation.
Every country should have its part in something like world war 3.
As the current geopolitical situations says, the major countries that would participate in WW3 would be America, China , Russia, India , Pakistan, Afghanistan, France,( somewhat Germany) ,Australia, North Korea and some other smaller countries.
In such warfare game, the ending should be that no country won the war. Everyone got defeated, but the humanity won.
The devastation and destruction caused by the war killed many innocents and vast area of lands became barren due to the nuclear power used.
The remaining people pledged themselves to not divide themselves into countries and made a world union something like European Union.
I think, that would be the most appropriate and satisfactory ending ( as we cannot call it a happy ending).

comment: I just wish that they went with a warzone style of killing system. Where if you do kill someone or in Battlefield's case 'down' someone in multiplayer you can then shoot their 'downed' body and make it so they can't be revived. Such as do 100 damage to someone and now they are "dead" and then shoot their "dead" body for 25 more points of damage and now that enemy cannot be revived and they have to respawn. Because, nothing is more annoying than killing 2 or 3 people in tight battle and then getting killed by a fourth person only for everyone you just killed to get revived back up. It's like you didn't even do anything. Also if you get a headshot kill on someone they shouldn't be able to be revived either. This is just my hot take on the revive mechanic in battlefield games.

author: Rennie Cohen

comment:
So, after reading all the comments, I did a bit of digging and turns out there were two versions of it. The OG BF1942 called Loopzook, which was created by ZookaMan and Stun_gravy that got inspired and created the infamous Rendezook.
Okay, you got that? Good.

Now there's a misunderstanding regarding the last reaction in the video. First of all, that person is WARning! Schemov and he is NOT Stun_gravy. Schemov is one of the people that popularized the term for Russian viewers.

Now that's out of the way, let's go talk about the second misunderstood comment. Schemov IS NOT ZookaMan. Again, let me repeat this. Schemov IS NOT ZookaMan. Actually, Schemov has commented multiple times that he's not the the original creator. ZookaMan is the original creator.
You can easily know that ZookaMan is not Schemov by simply typing his name on the search bar, look up his Loopzook video, and read his recent comment about the reveal trailer. Now, you could check that message and read it yourself but here's some parts of the transcript to give some context. ‚Äú..., it was amazing to see it done cinematically in the new trailer. BF1942 is actually still the last Battlefield game I've played, because funnily enough, I'm not that into FPS's....‚Äù He also mentioned that he had a second channel called ‚ÄúMessenjahMatt‚Äù where he would recreated famous Michael Jordan scenes in NBA 2K games style. He finished his thoughts by saying that he would sometimes go back to both of his channels after a few years gap to do something extra but he believes that his content creating days is over.

So, now we know that the three guys are all different people. Schemov still creates daily content, Stun_gravy kind of stopped posting content (although I did heard some news that after seeing this trailer, he would come back to the scene), and ZookaMan has retired from YouTube. Hope this clears out any confusion.

comment:
Here's a choice for gamers....
Rank these games in order u would like them to be released (assuming none of them is released yet)
Battlefield 2042
GTA 6
Witcher 3
Red dead redemption 2
Halo infinite
Dying light 2
Far cry 6
Cyberpunk

So ur first choice would be released after 1 yr and the 2 nd after 2 yrs and so on...
The only catch is that the later a game releases the more polished and glitch free it will be. So ur last choice will be released after 8 years but will run ultra smooth and first choice after 1 year but glitchy. 
OR
All of these games release at the same time after 4 years.
